availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: R. G. Johnson states that in the Spring of the year 1860 he purchased at Barroom of Jersey Haner In Stamping Ground; a Bottle of whiskey and gave Said Bottle of whiskey to Jack a Slave the property of John T. Sinclair that a Short time afterwards said Haner came into the Bar Room and Inquired if his BarKeeper if he had sold a Bottle of whiskey to said Slave the Bar Keeper Said he had not he Johnson then asked said Haner why he asked the question Haner Replied that M. N. Sinclair had caught said Jack with a Bottle of whiskey comeing from towards said Haner house he Johnson then told Haner that he had purchased said whiskey and given it to Jack He further States that at the Sitting of the next circuit court he understood that said Sinclair had reported said Haner to the Grand Jury and that Said Haner was Indited for said offence, that for Several courts after he was Summoned by Haner to testify in Haners behalf on Said Indictment that the cause was allways put off on account of the absence of said Sinclair, that he did not attend the last court supposing that ^it^ would be put off as it had before been done

Sworn to before me by R. G. Johnson this 28th day of Nov 1863
Charles Murphy J P S C

Scott Cir Ct
vs
J. Haner
Tipling

Remit all except costs & fees Dec 12th
Tho E Bramlette
132th Dec/ 63
